intro: Paronychia decandra, commonly known as the many-fruited goosefoot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its alternate, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by spherical, dry fruits that contain several seeds. Paronychia decandra is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
